sen.j: 物部氏（もののべうじ）は河内国の哮峰（現・大阪府交野市か）に天皇家よりも前に天孫降臨したとされるニギハヤヒミコトを祖先と伝えられる氏族。
sen.e: Mononobe clan is said to be a clan whose ancestor is Nigihayamikoto who is believed that decended to earth in Koho in Kawachi Province (presumably, present-day Katano City, Osaka Prefecture) before Imperial Family.

It is said that the Mononobe clan's ancestor is Nigihayamikoto, who is believed to have decended to earth in Koho, Kawachi Province (presumably, present-day Katano City, Osaka Prefecture) before the time of the Imperial Family.

It is said that the Mononobe clan's ancestor is Nigihayahimikoto, who is believed to have descended to earth in Koho, Kawachi Province (presumably, present-day Katano City, Osaka Prefecture) before the time of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: descendedスペル訂正しました。Nigihayahimikotoに訂正しました。family小文字にしました。

sen.j: 元々は兵器の製造・管理を主に管掌していたが、しだいに大伴氏とならぶ有力軍事氏族へと成長していった。
sen.e: Originally, the clan administered the manufacturing and maintenance of weapons and gradually grew to powerful military clan along with Otomo clan.
Originally, the clan administered the manufacturing and maintenance of weapons and gradually became a powerful military clan alongside the Otomo clan.
Originally, the clan administered the manufacturing and maintenance of weapons and gradually became a powerful military clan alongside the Otomo clan.

sen.j: 五世紀代の皇位継承争いにおいて軍事的な活躍を見せ、雄略朝には最高執政官を輩出するようになった。
sen.e: In fifth century, Mononobe showed great military performance in the conflict over succession of imperial throne and produced the chief administrator in the era of the Emperor Yuraku.
In the fifth century, the Mononobe clan showed great military performance in the conflict over succession of imperial throne and produced the chief administrator in the era of the Emperor Yuraku.
sen.cmt: Clarified that it was the clan not just one person.
sen.e: In the fifth century, the Mononobe clan showed great military performance in the conflict over succession of imperial throne and produced the chief administrator in the era of the Emperor Yuraku.

sen.j: 連のカバネ（かばね）、八色の姓の改革の時に朝臣姓を賜る。
sen.e: The Kabane (hereditary title) was formerly Muraji, but the clan was given the kabane of Ason after the reform of Kabane system (Yakusa no Kabane).

Their Kabane (hereditary title) was formerly Muraji, but the clan was given the kabane of Ason (the second highest of the eight hereditary titles) after the reform of the Kabane system (Yakusa no Kabane).

Their Kabane (hereditary title) was formerly Muraji, but the clan was given the kabane of Ason (the second highest of the eight hereditary titles) after the reform of the Kabane system (Yakusa no Kabane).

sen.j: 穂積氏、采女氏をはじめ、同族枝族のすこぶる多いことがその特徴として知られる。
sen.e: It is well known that there are so many clans that have same lineage like Hozumi clan and Uneme clan.
It is well known that there are many clans that have same lineage, such as the Hozumi clan and the Uneme clan.
It is well known that there are many clans that have same lineage, such as the Hozumi clan and the Uneme clan.

sen.j: 磐井の乱
sen.e: Iwai War
The Iwai War
sen.cmt: Fragment in paragraph section - unsure how to revise.
sen.e: The Iwai War

sen.j: 継体天皇の時代に九州北部で起こった磐井の乱の鎮圧を命じられたのが物部氏だった。
sen.e: It was Mononobe clan which was ordered to suppress Iwai War happened in northern Kyushu area during the era of the Emperor Keitai..
When the Iwai War occured in the northern Kyushu area during the era of the Emperor Keitai, it was the Mobonobe clan which was ordered to supress the revolt.
When the Iwai War occurred in the northern Kyushu area during the era of the Emperor Keitai, it was the Mononobe clan which was ordered to suppress the revolt.

sen.j: これを鎮圧した物部麁鹿火（あらかい）は宣化天皇の元年の7月に死去している。
sen.e: MONONOBE no Arakahi who quelled the war died in July in the first year of the Emperor Senka.
MONONOBE no Arakahi, who quelled the war, died in July in the first year of the Emperor Senka.
MONONOBE no Arakahi, who quelled the war, died in July in the first year of the Emperor Senka.

sen.j: 蘇我氏との対立
sen.e: Confrontation with Soga clan
Confrontation with the Soga clan
Confrontation with the Soga clan

sen.j: 宣化天皇の死後、欽明天皇になると物部尾輿（もののべのおこし、生没年不詳）が連（おおむらじ）になった。
sen.e: After the demise of the Emperor Senka, MONONOBE no Okoshi (year of birth and death unknown) was given the Kabane of Oomuraji in the era of the next Emperor Kinmei.
After the demise of the Emperor Senka, MONONOBE no Okoshi (year of birth and death unknown) was given the Kabane of Oomuraji in the era of the next Emperor Kinmei.
After the demise of the Emperor Senka, MONONOBE no Okoshi (year of birth and death unknown) was given the Kabane of Omuraji in the era of the next Emperor Kinmei.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によると、欽明天皇の時代百済から仏像が贈られた。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), a Buddha statue was sent from Baekje during the era of Kinmei.
According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), a Buddha statue was sent from Kudara during the era of Kinmei.
sen.cmt: In other files 百済 has been translated as Kudara.
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), a Buddha statue was sent from Kudara (Baekje) during the era of Emperor Kinmei.
sen.cmt: 百済は、ほかのファイルで「Baekje」となっているものもあり、両表記とも使用されているようなので、括弧で併記しました。原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。Emperor補足しました。

sen.j: これの扱いを巡り、蘇我稲目（大臣）を中心とする崇仏派と物部尾興、中臣鎌子を中心とする排仏派が争った。
sen.e: The pro-buddhist faction led by SOGA no Iname and the anti-Buddhist faction led by MONONOBE no Okoshi and NAKATOMI no Kamako struggled over how to treat this statue.
The pro-buddhist faction led by SOGA no Iname and the anti-Buddhist faction led by MONONOBE no Okoshi and NAKATOMI no Kamako struggled over how to treat this statue.
The pro-Buddhist faction led by SOGA no Iname and the anti-Buddhist faction led by MONONOBE no Okoshi and NAKATOMI no Kamako struggled over how to treat this statue.

sen.j: ただし、近年では物部氏の居住跡から氏寺（渋川廃寺）の遺構などが発見され、物部氏を単純な廃仏派として分類することは難しく、個々の氏族の崇拝の問題でなく、国家祭祀の対立であったとする見方もある。
sen.e: However, due to the recent discovery of the remains of former Shibulawa-ji Temple, a Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory) from the place of dwelling of Mononobe clan, it became diffucult to categorize the clan as just an anti-buddhist and some say that it was a confrontation not over the matters of each clan's reverence but over the religious service in national scale.

However, due to the recent discovery of the remains of former Shibulawa-ji Temple, which was an Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying for clan's glory) from the Mononobe clan's place of dwelling, it became difficult to categorize the clan as simply anti-buddhist, and some say that it was a confrontation not over the matters of each clan's reverence, but over religious services over a national scale.

However, due to the recent discovery of the remains of former Shibukawa-ji Temple, which was an Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying for clan's glory) from the Mononobe clan's place of dwelling, it became difficult to categorize the clan as simply anti-Buddhist, and some say that it was a confrontation not over the matters of each clan's reverence, but over religious services over a national scale.
sen.cmt: Buddhist大文字にしました。Shibukawaスペル訂正しました。

sen.j: 稲目・尾興の死後は蘇我馬子、物部守屋（もののべのもりや）に代替わりした。
sen.e: After the death of Iname and Okoshi, SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya took over.
After the death of Iname and Okoshi, SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya took over.
After the death of Iname and Okoshi, SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya took over.

sen.j: 守屋は蘇我氏の寺を襲い、仏像は川に投げ入れ、寺は焼くということをしてしまった。
sen.e: Moriya attacked the temple of Soga clan and threw the statue into the river, then set the temple on fire.
Moriya attacked the Soga clan's temple and threw the statue into the river, then set the temple on fire.
Moriya attacked the Soga clan's temple and threw the statue into the river, then set the temple on fire.

sen.j: そして3人の尼を鞭で打った。
sen.e: And he lashed three nuns.
Then he lashed three nuns.
Then he lashed three nuns.

sen.j: しかし、それ以後疫病が流行し用明天皇が崩御した。
sen.e: After that, a plague spread and the Emperor Yomei passed away.
After that, a plague spread and Emperor Yomei passed away.
After that, a plague spread and Emperor Yomei passed away.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: これにより皇后や皇子を支持基盤にもつ蘇我氏が有利になり、また天皇が生前、「仏教を敬うように」といった詔があったこともあり、先代の敏達天皇の皇后（用明天皇の姉。後の推古天皇）の命により蘇我氏及び連合軍は物部守屋に攻め込んだ。
sen.e: This helped Soga clan which was gaining strong support of the Empress and the Prince to move forward and, following the rescript of the Emperor during his life asking to respect Buddhism, Soga clan and the allied forces attacked Moriya ordered by the Empress of the former Emperor Bidatsu (sister of the Emperor Yomei and later the Emperor Suiko).

This helped the Soga clan which was gaining strong support from the Empress and the Prince and, following the decree made by the Emperor while still alive asking to respect Buddhism, the Soga clan and the allied forces attacked Moriya as ordered by the Empress of the former Emperor Bidatsu (sister of the Emperor Yomei and later the Emperor Suiko).
sen.cmt: I can't understand '用明天皇の姉。後の推古天皇'. This seems to imply that a woman became emperor??
sen.e: This helped the Soga clan which was gaining strong support from the Empress and the Prince and, following the decree made by the Emperor while still alive asking to respect Buddhism, the Soga clan and the allied forces attacked Moriya as ordered by the Empress of the former Emperor Bidatsu (the older sister of the Emperor Yomei and later the Empress Suiko).
sen.cmt: older補足しました。Empress Suikoとしました。

sen.j: 当初、物部守屋は有利であったが守屋は河内国渋川郡（現・大阪府東大阪市衣摺）の本拠地で戦死した。
sen.e: At first, Moriya gained the upper hand but he died in his base in Shibukawa County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kizuri, Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture).
At first, Moriya gained the upper hand but he died in his base in Shibukawa County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kizuri, Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture).
At first, Moriya MONONOBE gained the upper hand but he died in his base in Shibukawa County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kizuri, Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 石上氏
sen.e: Isonokami clan
The Isonokami clan
The Isonokami clan

sen.j: 西暦686年（朱鳥元年）までに物部氏から改めた石上氏（いそのかみうじ）が本宗家の地位を得た。
sen.e: By 686, Isonokamiuji which changed their name from Mononobe gained the position as the head family.
Known as the Mononobe clan up until 686, from then on the name changed as the Isonokamiuji clan gained the position as head family.
Known as the Mononobe clan up until 686, from then on the name changed as the Isonokami clan gained the position as head family.

sen.j: 同氏は守屋の兄の子孫であると称している。
sen.e: The Isonokami clan called itself a descendant of the older brother of Moriya.
The Isonokami clan called itself a descendant of the older brother of Moriya.
The Isonokami clan called itself a descendant of the older brother of Moriya.

sen.j: 雄略朝の大連・物部目の後裔を称する石上麻呂には朝臣の姓が与えられて、西暦708年（和銅元年）に左大臣。
sen.e: ISONOKAMI no Maro who called himself descendant of MONONOBE no Me who was Omuraji in the era of the Emperor Yuraku was given the kabane of Ason and was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) in 708.
sen.cmt: 石上麻呂→ISONOKAMI no Maro ［角川書店 新版日本史辞典］
sen.e: ISONOKAMI no Maro, who called himself a descendant of MONONOBE no Me (who was Omuraji in the era of the Emperor Yuraku), was given the kabane of Ason and was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 708.

ISONOKAMI no Maro, who called himself a descendant of MONONOBE no Me (who was Omuraji in the era of the Emperor Yuryaku), was given the kabane of Ason and was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in 708.

sen.j: その死にあたっては廃朝の上、従一位を贈られた。
sen.e: When he died, the Emperor mourned over the death and he posthumously received Juichii (Junior First Rank).
When he died, the Emperor mourned over the death and he posthumously received Juichii (Junior First Rank).
When he died, the Emperor mourned over the death and he posthumously received Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 息子の石上乙麻呂は孝謙天皇の時代に中納言、乙麻呂の息子の石上宅嗣は桓武天皇の時代に大納言にまで昇った。
sen.e: His son, ISONOKAMI no Otomaro was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor Koken and the son of Otomaro, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor kanmu.

His son, ISONOKAMI no Otomaro was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor Koken and the son of Otomaro, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor kanmu.

His son, ISONOKAMI no Otomaro was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor Koken and the son of Otomaro, ISONOKAMI no Yakatsugu was promoted to Dainagon (chief councilor of state) in the era of the Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。Emperor Kanmu大文字にしました。

sen.j: また宅嗣は、日本初の図書館・芸亭の創設者としても歴史に名を残している。
sen.e: Yakatsugu goes down in history as a first founder of the Untei (the first public library in Japan).
Yakatsugu goes down in history as the founder of the Untei (the first public library in Japan).
sen.cmt: Wording - no need for repition of 'first'.
sen.e: Yakatsugu goes down in history as the founder of the Untei (the first public library in Japan).

sen.j: 石上氏は宅嗣の死後、9世紀前半ころに衰退。
sen.e: Isonokami clan declined in the early nineth century after the death of Yakatsugu.
The Isonokami clan declined in the early nineth century after the death of Yakatsugu.
The Isonokami clan declined in the early ninth century after the death of Yakatsugu.

sen.j: 地方の物部氏
sen.e: Mononobe clan in the regions
The Mononobe clan in the provinces
The Mononobe clan in the provinces

sen.j: 物部氏の特徴のひとつに広範な地方分布が挙げられ、無姓の物部氏も含めるとその例は枚挙に遑がない。
sen.e: Mononobe clan is distributed throughout the country, which characterizes the clan and, including Mononobes which are not given Kabane, they are too numerous to count.
A characteristic of the Mononobe clan was its distribution throughout the country, and including Mononobes which are not given Kabane, they are too numerous to count.
A characteristic of the Mononobe clan was its distribution throughout the country, and including Mononobes which are not given Kabane, they are too numerous to count.

sen.j: 石上氏等中央の物部氏族とは別に、古代東北地方などに物部氏を名乗る人物が地方官に任ぜられている記録がある。
sen.e: Aside from Mononobe clan living in the capital like Isonokami clan, a historical record is left that a person calling himself Mononobe was appointed to the regional officer in Tohoku region of ancient times.

Aside from those Mononobe clan living in the capital like the Isonokami clan, a historical record is left that a person calling himself Mononobe was appointed to the regional officer in Tohoku region of ancient times.

Aside from those Mononobe clan living in the capital like the Isonokami clan, a historical record is left that a person calling himself Mononobe was appointed to the regional officer in Tohoku region of ancient times.

sen.j: 所謂「古史古伝」のひとつである物部文書に拠ると出羽物部氏は物部守屋の子孫と称し、扶桑略記、陸奥話記などには物部長頼が陸奥大目となったことが記載されている。
sen.e: According to "Mononobe Bunsho", one of the so-called Koshi Koden (Ancient History and Legends), Dewamononobe clan called itself a descendant of Mononobe no Moriya, and Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan) and Mutsu Waki say that MONONOBE no Nagayori was appointed to Mutsu no Daisakan.
sen.cmt: 物部文書→Mononobe Bunsho (物部文書) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］出羽物部氏→Dewamononbeclan (出羽物部氏) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］物部長頼→MONONOBE no Nagayori (物部長頼) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］陸奥話記→Mutsu Waki ［角川書店 新版日本史辞典］陸奥大目→Mutsu no Daisakan (陸奥大目) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］
sen.e: According to "Mononobe Bunsho", one of the so-called Koshi Koden (Ancient History and Legends), The Dewamononobe clan called itself a descendant of Mononobe no Moriya, and Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan) and Mutsu Waki say that MONONOBE no Nagayori was appointed to Mutsu no Daisakan.
sen.cmt: Wording. Needs an explanation of Mutsu no Daisakan.
sen.e: According to "Mononobe Bunsho," one of the so-called 'Koshi Koden' (Ancient History and Legends), the Dewa-Mononobe clan called itself a descendant of MONONOBE no Moriya, and Fuso Ryakki (A Brief History of Japan) and Mutsu Waki (A Tale of Mutsu) say that MONONOBE no Nagayori was appointed to Mutsu no Daisakan (the fourth rank officer).
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。' '補足しました。the小文字にしました。Dewa-Mononobeに訂正しました。MONONOBE no Moriyaに訂正しました。(A Tale of Mutsu)補足しました。(the fourth rank officer)補足しました。

sen.j: しかし、出羽物部氏が本当に守屋の子孫かどうか確実な証拠はない。
sen.e: However, no evidence of whether Dewamononobe clan is a real descendant of Moriya can be found.
However, no evidence of whether the Dewamononobe clan is a real descendant of Moriya can be found.
However, no evidence of whether the Dewamononobe clan is a real descendant of Moriya can be found.

sen.j: 六国史に散見する俘囚への賜姓例の中には、吉弥候氏が物部斯波連を賜ったという記録も見える。
sen.e: In the examples of shisei (conferring surname) to barbarians found in Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), there is a record that Kimiko clan was given Mononobe no Shiwa no Muraji.
sen.cmt: 賜姓→shisei (conffering surname)と訳出しました吉弥候氏→Kimiko clan (吉弥候氏) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］物部斯波連→Mononobe no Shiwa no Muraji (物部斯波連) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］
sen.e: Among the examples of shisei (conferring a surname) to barbarians found in Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), there is a record that the Kimiko clan was given Mononobe no Shiwa no Muraji.
sen.cmt: Wording, needs an explanation of Shiwa no Muraji.
sen.e: Among the examples of shisei (conferring a surname) to barbarians found in Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), there is a record that the Kimiko clan was given the Muraji of Mononobe no Shiwa.
sen.cmt: 物部斯波連→the Muraji of Mononobe no Shiwa [http://mononobe.nobody.jp/mononohuyasoudi/clan-dictionary3magyou.html] としました。吉弥候氏→Kimiko clan [http://kotobank.jp/]

sen.j: また、下総国匝瑳郡に本拠を持つ物部匝瑳連の祖先伝承に、物部布都久留 の子で物部木蓮子の弟の物部小事が関東地方に進出したというものがある。
sen.e: In a tradition handing down from the ancestor of Mononobe no Sosa Muraji based in Sosa County, Shimousa Province, there is also a record that MONONOBE no Ogoto who was a child of MONONOBE no Futsukuru and was a younger brother of MONONOBE no Itabi entered into Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 匝瑳郡→Sosa County (匝瑳郡) ［読み方は角川書店 新版日本史辞典及び日本郵政HPを参照し判断］物部匝瑳連→Mononobe no Sosa Muraji (物部匝瑳連) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］物部布都久留→MONONOBE no Futsukuru (物部布都久留) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］物部木蓮子→MONONOBE no Itabi (物部木蓮子) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］
sen.e: In a tradition handed down from the ancestors of Mononobe no Sosa Muraji based in Sosa County, Shimousa Province, there is also a record that MONONOBE no Ogoto, who was a child of MONONOBE no Futsukuru and a younger brother of MONONOBE no Itabi, entered into the Kanto region.

In a tradition handed down from the ancestors of Mononobe no Sosa Muraji based in Sosa County, Shimousa Province, there is also a record that MONONOBE no Ogoto, who was a child of MONONOBE no Futsukuru and a younger brother of MONONOBE no Itabi, entered into the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: 物部匝瑳連→Muraji of Mononobe no Sosa [http://mononobe.nobody.jp/mononohuyasoudi/clan-dictionary.html]物部布都久留→MONONOBE no Futsukuru [http://mononobe.nobody.jp/jinbutu/mononobejinbutu3magyou.html#magyou114]

sen.j: これについては常陸国信太郡との関連を指摘する説があり、香取神宮と物部氏の関連も指摘されている。
sen.e: About this tradition, the other theory to point out the relation with Shita County, Hitachi Province exists and the connection between Katori-jingu Shrine and Mononobe clan is also said.
sen.cmt: 信太郡→Shita County (信太郡) ［読み方は角川書店 新版日本史辞典を参照し判断］
sen.e: There is a theory regarding this that points to a connection with Shita County, Hitachi Province, and also a connection between Katori-jingu Shrine and the Mobonobe clan.
There is a theory regarding this that points to a connection with Shita County, Hitachi Province, and also a connection between Katori-jingu Shrine and the Mononobe clan.

sen.j: 古代尾張国の東部に物部氏の集落があり、現在は物部神社と、武器庫であったと伝えられる高牟神社が残っている。
sen.e: The settlement of Mononobe clan was located in the eastern part of Owari Province of ancient times and, now, Takamu-Jinja Shrine which is said to have been an arsenal and Mononobe-jinja Shrine are remained.

A settlement of the Mononobe clan was located in the eastern part of Owari Province of ancient times, and Takamu-Jinja Shrine, which is said to have been an arsenal, and Mononobe-jinja Shrine still remain today.

A settlement of the Mononobe clan was located in the eastern part of Owari Province of ancient times, and Takamu-Jinja Shrine, which is said to have been an arsenal, and Mononobe-jinja Shrine still remain today.

sen.j: 石見国の一の宮「物部神社 (大田市)」（島根県大田市）は、部民設置地説以外に古代出雲に対する鎮めとして創建されたとする説もある。
sen.e: There is also a theory that Mononobe-jinja Shrine (Oda City, Shimane Prefecture) which is "ichinomiya" (a shrine occupying the highest rank among the shrines of a province) of Iwami Province was built as an appeasement for ancient Izumo except for Benotamisecchichisetsu, and the shake (family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis), kaneko family was called Iwami no Kuninomiyatsuko and considered as the chief of Mononobe in this region.
sen.cmt: 部民設置地説→ Benotamisecchichisetsu(部民設置地説) ［原文の意味が不明］石見国造→Iwami no Kuninomiyatsuko (石見国造) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］
sen.e: There is also a theory that Mononobe-jinja Shrine (Oda City, Shimane Prefecture), which is an 'ichinomiya' (a shrine occupying the highest rank among the shrines of a province) of Iwami Province was built as an appeasement for ancient Izumo except for Benotamisecchichisetsu.
sen.cmt: Too long - split into two sentences.
sen.e: There is also a theory that 'Mononobe-jinja Shrine' (Oda City, Shimane Prefecture), which is an ichinomiya (a shrine occupying the highest rank among the shrines of a province) of Iwami Province was built as an appeasement for ancient Izumo except for the theory of arm control.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。原文に合せて' 'を補足、削除しました。部民設置地説→ the theory of arm control としました。

sen.j: 社家の金子家は「石見国造」と呼ばれ、この地の物部氏の長とされた。
sen.e: The Kaneko family, which was a shake (family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis), was called Iwami no Kuninomiyatsuko and considered as the chief of the Mononobe clan in this region.

The Kaneko family, which was a shake (family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis), was called Iwami no Kuninomiyatsuko and considered as the chief of the Mononobe clan in this region.

sen.j: 戦前は華族として男爵に列している。
sen.e: Before the war, it was ranked in Danshaku (baron) as the peerage.
Before the war, the family held the peerage of Danshaku (baron).
sen.cmt: I assume this is refering to the Iwami family
sen.e: Before the war, the family held the peerage of Danshaku (baron).

sen.j: 子孫
sen.e: Descendant
Descendants
Descendants

sen.j: 長門守護の厚東氏、物部神社神主家の金子氏、広瀬神社神主家の曾禰氏の他、江戸幕府の幕臣 荻生徂徠などが子孫といわれる。
sen.e: It is said that Koto clan, Shugo of Nagato and Kaneko clan, the family of Shinto priest of Mononobe-jinja Shrine, and Sone clan, the family of Shinto priest of Hirose-jinja Shrine and Sorai Ogyu, shogun's retainer in the Edo bakufu are the descendents.
sen.cmt: 曾禰氏→Sone clan (曾禰氏) ［定訳不明：読み方を確認することができませんでした］
sen.e: It is said that the Koto clan, Shugo of Nagato and Kaneko clan, the family of Shinto priest of Mononobe-jinja Shrine, and Sone clan, the family of Shinto priest of Hirose-jinja Shrine and Sorai Ogyu, shogun's retainer in the Edo bakufu are the descendents.
sen.cmt: Was unable to read names so cannot confirm translation.
sen.e: It is said that the Koto clan, the military governor of Nagato and Kaneko clan, the family of Shinto priest of Mononobe-jinja Shrine, and Sone clan, the family of Shinto priest of Hirose-jinja Shrine and Sorai OGYU, shogun's retainer in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) are the descendents.
sen.cmt: the military governor of Nagato に訂正しました。曾禰氏→Sone clanSorai OGYUに訂正しました。Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)としました。
